entry.title: SAP Integration Suite: What’s New in Q3/2025
entry.content:
Another quarter has come to an end and it’s time for us to review the most recent updates and improvements delivered to SAP Integration Suite. Whether you’re an integration architect, developer, or business leader, these new features are designed to help you get the most out of your hybrid landscape. Read on to discover what’s new and how these enhancements can support your organisation’s integration goals.

Message status overview monitoring for large tenants

One awaited featured has been released to the Cloud Integration capability of SAP Integration Suite to improve Message Status Overview monitoring and support larger time intervals through data preaggregation. Now the monitoring option can be utilized for extended periods on tenants with a high volume of message processing logs.

Artificial Intelligence

AI-based integration flow generation with mediation steps

Earlier this year, the generation of integration flows with the assistance of AI was made available to customers. This enable users to generate an integration flow with sender and receiver systems based on a scenario description provided in natural language. You can read more about it here.

In Q3/2025 we have enhanced this feature to include additional mediation steps. This means that now, users can provide even more detailed scenarios and the tool identifies the details and generates a comprehensive integration flow with the described components, systems, and actions. Get a first glimpse into how to use this feature in the blog post: SAP Integration Suite – Generative AI based Integration Flow Generation with Mediation Steps.

 Business Accelerators

Joule copilot-based conversational search and discovery of content

Joule has arrived at the SAP Business Accelerator Hub in Q3 to help users find the right content throughconversational context-based search. The Joule-based discovery provides user guidance to search different artifacts and access cohesive information for other relevant sources, such as help documentation.

Note: The feature is currently in the beta phase and you can find more details on availability here.  

Connectivity and Adapters

The latest releases of SAP Integration Suite introduced a new array of adapters and connectors designed to streamline and enhance connectivity, improve data flow, and foster a more integrated digital landscape for businesses leveraging SAP solutions.

AI adapter

The recently released AI adapter for SAP Integration Suite functions as a receiver adapter and accelerates connectivity to the Generative AI Hub (SAP AI Core) and other AI providers, as needed by customer (BYOM).

 The benefit of this adapter is that it increases connectivity options to integrate with both SAP and third-party systems and applications. How it works: after configuration, data exchange is performed at runtime where the SAP Integration Suite tenant sends the operation request to GenAIHub. The AI Adapter works on the request and sends the data back to the SAP Integration Suite tenant.

Find the AI Adapter at SAP Business Accelerator Hub, read the help documentation, and check out the short demo below:

Further adapters released in Q3 include:

IBM MQ adapter using JMS protocol: client certificate supportSupports Client Certificate based authentication for JMS Variants. A new version 1.3.0 of the IBM MQ adapter supports Client Certificate based authentication for JMS Variants.- Configure the IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter
IBM MQ adapter using JMS protocol: client certificate supportSupports On-Premise Connectivity via Cloud Connector for JMS Variants. A new version 1.4.0 of the IBM MQ adapter supports On-Premise Connectivity via Cloud Connector for JMS Variants.

- Configure the IBM MQ JMS Sender Adapter

- Configure the IBM MQ JMS Receiver Adapter
BigCommerce adapterFacilitates the connectivity to BigCommerce GraphQL & REST Admin APIs, accelerates the implementation time and reduces complexity of connecting to BigCommerce. This adapter is available on SAP Business Accelerator Hub.

- BigCommerce Adapter at SAP Business Accelerator Hub

- BigCommerce Receiver Adapter

🚀🚀Discover the latest content packages, including APIs and Integrations, released on the SAP Business Accelerator Hub by our partners in Q3 2025. These releases come with high-level details to help you understand their features and benefits.

API-Centric & Event-Driven Integrations

Support for reusable API artifacts in Edge Integration Cell

Customers can now leverage components, endpoints, and services across multiple applications, projects, or contexts, without having to perform significant adaptations. The reusability of API artifacts enables companies to implement a centralized security and traffic management system for exposed APIs. It not only enhances compliance and reduces misconfiguration risks but also significantly lowers both the total cost of development and ownership by eliminating redundant configurations and promoting the reuse of existing API artifacts, which means additional API calls are avoided, leading to cost savings. Learn more.

 

Watch the demo from this year's Devtoberfest - Session "Next generation hybrid integration with Edge Integration Cell":

Integration of Advanced Event Mesh with SAP Cloud Application Event Hub

The latest updates allow you to connect your SAP Integration Suite, advanced event mesh system to SAP Cloud Application Event Hub for the consumption and exposure of events.

SAP Cloud Application Event Hub creates a clear, user-friendly, and adaptable way to easily exchange business events across SAP's cloud landscape. The solution is a key part of SAP's event-driven architecture. With the integration, you can access events from various SAP business systems, published via the hub, directly on SAP Integration Suite's advanced event mesh.

Migration & Modernization

ABAP proxy generation from service interfaces for current users of SAP Process Orchestration

SAP Integration Suite now supports the implementation of existing use cases for the Enterprise Services Repository using an efficient API-first development methodology. This assists users in importing the service interface artifacts from their PI/PO systems to the Cloud Integration workspace. The feature includes the ability to generate and update ABAP Proxies (non-language-specific interface descriptions in Web Services Description Language converted into executable interfaces) in SAP backend or S/4 HANA systems by connecting them to the SAP Integration Suite tenant and it’s available in the multi-cloud environment. Find more details and the prerequisites here.

Migration assessment: Clean core modernization recommendations for BAPIs

This extension of the Migration Assessment capability in SAP Integration Suite makes it possible for users to analyse used BAPIs in SAP Process Orchestration. Additionally, they receive recommendations available in the SAP Business Accelerator Hub to transition from legacy content and adopt a clean core approach, e.g. replacing RFCs (BAPIs) with SOAP/OData APIs, IDOCs with Business Events, Alert Rules by SAP Cloud ALM, and more. Explore all modernization recommendations covered in each area.

Dive Deeper

New learning offerings available

Accelerating Hybrid Integrations with SAP Integration Suite on SUSE Rancher Set up, deploy, and operate Edge Integration Cell on SUSE Rancher Kubernetes EngineTime investment 3h, Record of achievement
Accelerating Hybrid Integrations with SAP Integration Suite on RedHat OpenShift Set up, deploy, and run an Edge Integration Cell on Red Hat OpenShiftTime investment 3h, Record of achievement
Exploring Enterprise Automation with SAPUnderstand how SAP Signavio, SAP Build, and SAP Integration Suite work together to improve efficiency and responsiveness Time investment 1.5h, Record of achievement

What’s next?

  • Integration @ Devtoberfest: watch all sessions
  • Join us at SAP TechEd 2025: explore the Integration track and register

entry.title: SAP S4 HANA Finance integration and Use case with SAP Joule
entry.content:
What Is SAP Joule?

SAP Joule is SAP’s AI copilot embedded across its cloud applications. It offers four interaction types—Transactional, Navigational, Informational, and Analytical—that let users perform business tasks via natural language within SAP environments. It understands user context, roles, permissions, and remains secure by design. It can also ground responses in your own business documents.

 How SAP Joule works in Public vs. Private Cloud is one of the most important considerations for finance teams (especially in FICO) deciding on adoption.

Here’s a structured view:

 SAP Joule in Public vs. Private Cloud

Deployment & Integration

  • Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)
    • Joule is natively embedded and updated by SAP automatically.
    • Integration with SAP FICO apps (GL, AP, AR, Asset Accounting, Controlling) is out of the box.
    • No additional installation required - users just activate and configure.
  • Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)
    • Joule can be enabled, but may require additional setup and integration.
    • Some Joule features might lag behind public cloud, because public gets innovations first.
    • Still integrates with FICO, but might require extra configuration & tenant connections to SAP BTP.

Feature Availability

  • Public Cloud
    • Joule supports all 4 interaction types (Transactional, Navigational, Informational, Analytical) directly in Fiori apps.
    • Example in FICO: “Post vendor invoice” → transaction executes directly.
    • Faster delivery of Joule Agents and Joule Studio.
  • Private Cloud
    • Informational & Analytical features available early (queries, reports, insights).
    • Transactional flows may require enablement through custom skills/agents.
    • Joule Studio can still be connected via SAP BTP, but adoption speed depends on customer’s upgrade cycle.

Customization & Extensibility

  • Public Cloud
    • Limited custom coding—extensions must go through SAP BTP side-by-side development.
    • Joule skills/agents are mostly standardized.
    • Great if you want speed & standardization.
  • Private Cloud
    • More flexibility: you can create custom FICO processes, reports, and Joule agents.
    • Easier to integrate with on-prem or legacy systems.
    • Suited for companies with complex finance processes.

Data Security & Residency

  • Public Cloud
    • Data is hosted on SAP-managed hyperscalers (AWS, Azure, GCP, SAP DCs).
    • Joule queries financial data via secure APIs; customers rely on SAP’s compliance.
  • Private Cloud
    • You control hosting, location, and more of the security stack.
    • Some finance-heavy industries (banking, defense, public sector) may prefer this for regulatory reasons.

Upgrade & Innovation

  • Public Cloud
    • Quarterly upgrades → Joule features arrive first and fastest.
    • Example: New Joule Agents for FICO tasks (like dispute resolution) appear immediately.
  • Private Cloud
    • Annual upgrades (with optional Feature Packs).
    • Joule features arrive later—innovation follows public cloud by a few cycles.

 Comparison Table

Aspect

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Availability

Native, out-of-the-box

Needs setup, later adoption

Updates

Quarterly, fastest innovations

Annual/controlled upgrades

Customization

Limited, BTP-based

Flexible, deep customizations

Security

SAP-managed hyperscalers

Customer-controlled

FICO Use Cases

Immediate transactional & analytical support

Strong for complex, regulated finance scenarios

Joule Studio

Fully available

Available via BTP, more flexible

 Which is Better for FICO?

  • Public Cloud → Best if you want rapid innovation, standard finance processes, faster AI adoption.
  • Private Cloud → Best if you need deep customization, strict compliance, hybrid IT integration.

 SAP Joule version requirements for S/4HANA Cloud editions (Public and Private):

  1. SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
  • Joule arrived as part of the Public Cloud starting around Q3 2024, and is embedded in all releases thereafter, including 2408 (August 2024) and onward.
  • While Joule is built into these releases, you still need proper entitlement and authorization to use it; this may require activation via your SAP admin or account executive.
  • There are setup guides available detailing how to activate Joule once entitlement is granted.

In Summary:

If your system is on Public Cloud release 2408 (Aug 2024) or later, Joule is already supported—assuming you've got the right access and permissions.

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition

  • Joule is available in the Private Cloud as well, but requires setup and configuration. It's not automatically active—you must enable it via SAP BTP and Joule Studio.
  • Technical prerequisites include ensuring the UI5 version in your system meets or exceeds the minimum required for Joule integration. The specific UI5 version will depend on your release; you can consult SAP documentation for exact details.

In Summary:

Private Cloud systems can support Joule—but you must set it up, ensure the UI5 stack is compatible, and configure the feature via BTP.

SAP S/4HANA On-Premise (Classic)

  • Joule is not supported on on-premise S/4HANA. SAP has confirmed it's not on the current roadmap for classic on-premise systems.
  • There’s a planned strategy—possibly coming Q1 2025—to enable Joule via SAP Build Work Zone, BTP, and Joule Studio even for on-prem systems. But as of now, Joule remains unavailable on-prem and unsupported.

High-Level Overview

Edition

Supported from (release)

Requirements

Public Cloud

2408 (Aug 2024) onward

Needs entitlement/authorization & activation

Private Cloud

Post-2024 releases

Requires UI5 prerequisites + BTP/Joule Studio setup

On-Premise (classic)

Not supported (as of now)

No Joule availability; roadmap may include future BTP-based solution

Summary:

  • Public Cloud: Joule is supported starting with 2408 onward—activate it via entitlement.
  • Private Cloud: Joule is available but not automatic—requires UI compliance + setup via BTP.
  • On-Premise: Joule is not supported yet; no built-in version availability.

Here’s how SAP Joule, SAP’s generative AI assistant, can be applied specifically within the SAP FICO (Finance & Controlling) domain:

SAP Joule Application in FICO

  • Transactional Interactions

Joule allows users to perform CRUD operations and manage financial documents via natural language—imagine asking:

  • “Post a vendor invoice of $5,000 to account X with due date Y.”
  • “Show me the status of PO invoice 10234.”
    While SAP hasn't yet released out-of-the-box FICO conversational flows, Joule’s transactional model supports this kind of interaction across cloud applications.
  • Navigational Interactions

Instead of navigating through menus to reach Fiori apps like “Display GL Account Balances,” you could simply ask:

  • “Where can I review G/L balances?”
    Joule will direct you to the relevant screen.
  • Informational Interactions

Straight answers instead of digging through help docs. You can ask:

  • “What’s the difference between cost center and profit center accounting?”
  • “Explain account determination for automatic postings.”
    Joule will deliver concise explanations, referencing SAP documentation or your own policy documents.

Analytical Interactions

Joule bridges your natural-language queries to data analytics:

  • “Show me quarterly expense trends per cost center.”
  • “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
    It returns charts, metrics, or dashboards—leveraging SAP Analytics Cloud integration.

Advanced: Joule Agents & Studio

Joule Agents

SAP has introduced AI agents—autonomous actors capable of executing complex, multi-step workflows across business functions. In FICO, custom agents could:

  • Automate dispute resolution: Collaborate across finance and service teams to validate discrepancies and propose corrections.
  • Cash collection workflows: Analyze overdue invoices, coordinate with collections, and initiate follow-ups.
    These agents are part of SAP’s cross-functional automation strategy.

Joule Studio (within SAP Build)

No-code/low-code tool to create custom skills or agents tailored for your FICO needs:

  • Build a skill to automatically generate internal financial reports, or trigger approval workflows.
  • Automate vendor reconciliation or recurring postings by designing tailored AI agents.
    These skills and agents integrate across SAP and non-SAP systems.

Summary Table

Joule Capability

FICO Use Case Example

Transactional

Post invoices, check payment status via natural language

Navigational

Ask “Where to view Cost Center Reports?”

Informational

Clarify financial terms or posting rules

Analytical

Generate trends and KPI charts using SAC

Agents & Studio

Automate dispute resolution, cash collection, approvals

Key Benefits in FICO

  • Boost Productivity: Save time by speaking instead of clicking through screens.
  • Reduce Errors: Leverage conversational clarity and auto-generated documents.
  • Improve Insights: Conduct data reviews and root cause analysis through simple dialogue.
  • Automate Complex Workflows: Agents handle multi-step tasks such as reconciliations or approvals automatically.

Real-World Usage Context -- Caveats

While SAP is rapidly developing Joule’s capabilities, many implementations remain in pilot or PoC stages. Users in forums report limited early usage, primarily for basic navigation or queries.

Here are concrete FICO scenarios where you could pilot SAP Joule and even extend it with Joule Agents / Studio:

 Pilot Scenarios in SAP FICO

  1. Invoice & Payment Handling
  • Ask Joule:
    “Post an invoice for vendor ABC with $12,000 due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Action: Creates the posting, validates tax code, and confirms with you.
  • Extension with Agent: Automate follow-up—if payment not cleared by due date, Joule Agent triggers a reminder email or escalates.
  1. Month-End Close Assistant
  • Ask Joule:
    “What are the pending tasks for month-end close?”
  • Joule Action: Lists open items (accruals, GR/IR clearing, reconciliations).
  • Extension with Agent: Automate recurring accrual postings and send alerts to approvers who are late in providing confirmations.
  1. Financial Analysis & Insights
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me expense trend per cost center for last 6 months.”
  • Joule Action: Returns a chart (via SAC integration).
  • Extension with Agent: Forecast next quarter’s expenses and flag cost centers that may exceed budgets.
  1. Audit & Compliance Checks
  • Ask Joule:
    “List journal entries above $50,000 in the last quarter without approvals.”
  • Joule Action: Generates a filtered list.
  • Extension with Agent: Create an automated internal audit agent that periodically checks for compliance exceptions and notifies controllers.
  1. Treasury & Cash Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “What is today’s cash position?”
  • Joule Action: Summarizes bank balances, incoming/outgoing payments.
  • Extension with Agent: Auto-generate a daily treasury dashboard at 9 AM and send to CFO.
  1. Dispute & Collections Management
  • Ask Joule:
    “Show me customers with invoices overdue > 60 days.”
  • Joule Action: Lists overdue accounts.
  • Extension with Agent: An AI agent sends personalized payment reminders and schedules calls with collections staff.
  1. Budget vs. Actual Control
  • Ask Joule:
    “Which cost centers exceeded budget last quarter?”
  • Joule Action: Shows variances with drill-down.
  • Extension with Agent: Automatically notify budget owners when variances exceed a threshold (say 10%).

 How to Design in Joule Studio

In Joule Studio (within SAP Build) you can:

  1. Create a Skill → “Generate quarterly P&L by company code and send PDF to finance team.”
  2. Create an Agent → “Monitor overdue vendor payments and auto-initiate dunning.”
  3. Connect Non-SAP Apps → e.g., send approvals via MS Teams or Slack.

 

 This way, Joule moves from a copilot (answering queries) to a colleague (executing finance tasks for you).

 

Deep Dive on one of the real-world example: Vendor Invoice Posting with SAP Joule in Public vs Private Cloud.

 Example: Vendor Invoice Posting with Joule

 Scenario

A finance user wants to post a vendor invoice for Vendor 300012, amount $12,000, due in 30 days.

 Public Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
    “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.
  • Joule Process:
    1. Understands the intent (“Create Vendor Invoice”).
    2. Pulls relevant master data (Vendor 300012 details, tax code, payment terms).
    3. Pre-fills the invoice screen in Fiori.
    4. User confirms → Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Public Cloud:
    • Joule can immediately display the document number and due date schedule.
    • If connected to SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC), Joule can also show how this impacts cash outflow forecast.
    • Minimal setup → available out-of-the-box.

 Private Cloud (SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition)

  • User says to Joule:
     “Post a vendor invoice of $12,000 for Vendor 300012, due in 30 days.”
  • Joule Process:
    • Provide navigation → “Open FB60 (Vendor Invoice Entry)” or “Fiori App: Create Supplier Invoice.”
    • Pre-fill metadata only if integrated with custom Joule Skill via Joule Studio.
    1. Joule recognizes intent, but instead of direct posting, it may:
    2. User manually confirms or adjusts in the classic posting screen (e.g., FB60 / MIRO).
    3. Invoice is posted.
  • Extras in Private Cloud:
    • You can customize Joule Agent (via Joule Studio + BTP) to enforce company-specific validations (e.g., block invoices >$10,000 without 2 approvals).
    • Joule can connect to legacy non-SAP apps (like OCR invoice scanners or in-house workflow systems).
    • Requires more setup & governance compared to Public Cloud.

 Side-by-Side Comparison

Step

Public Cloud

Private Cloud

Activation

Native, plug-and-play

Needs setup & integration

Invoice Posting

Joule executes directly in Fiori app

Joule suggests navigation, may require custom agent for automation

Data Validation

Standard rules auto-applied

Flexible, can embed custom compliance rules

User Effort

Minimal (voice/text → posted)

Moderate (confirmation in screen, extra steps if no custom agent)

Analytics

Immediate cash flow impact via SAC

Possible, but may need manual SAC integration

Customization

Limited (SAP-standard process)

Flexible (custom workflows, approvals, legacy integration)

Key Takeaway:

  • In Public Cloud, Joule = speed + simplicity → perfect for companies with standard finance processes.
  • In Private Cloud, Joule = control + flexibility → better if you need extra compliance steps, custom posting logic, or hybrid integration.

entry.title: BTP Trial Update: CF Runtime Availability
entry.content:
Dear SAP BTP trial community,

 
We always aimed to give users the most freedom and flexibility in the SAP BTP trial to ensure that everyone can test and explore our software or use it for learning purposes. For the next weeks, the SAP BTP trial will not be able to deliver this experience for new SAP BTP trial accounts as we have to prioritize the security and reliability of our SAP BTP trial system. We are experiencing an unusually high amount of misuse limiting the availability for all of our users. 
 
Therefore, we decided to temporarily reduce the offering for the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime for new BTP Trial Accounts. You will still be able to build applications and preview them, but deployment in the SAP BTP Cloud Foundry runtime will not be possible for the next weeks. 
 
How can you still explore SAP BTP? 
  • All other services will remain available and can be explored on the SAP Discovery Center
  • Leverage our SAP Basic trial offerings 
  • As a partner: Refer to our newly released free TDD licenses
  • As a customer: Leverage the free tier offering as part of Pay-As-You-Go for SAP BTP available in the SAP Store
 

All updates will be posted in the SAP Community. 

If you have an existing account that was created before October 15th, you are not affected. 
 
See you soon, 
SAP BTP trial product team

entry.title: Creating a personal development environment #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025
entry.content:
Creating a personal development environment #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025

  1. #1 - Why Neovim?
  2. #2 - Miscellaneous, status line, and color scheme
  3. #3 - Vim keybindings
  4. #4 - A custom theme for SAP TechEd 2025 (this blog post)

Building on top of the previous three blog posts, this blog post will focus on creating a custom theme for Neovim, inspired by the SAP TechEd 2025 branding.

I always enjoy playing around with themes in editors and the SAP TechEd branding was the perfect blueprint to work on a real custom theme for Neovim for the first time. I had previously only changed a few colors in existing themes or applied background images via local config files, but never created a full theme that also others could actually use. So let's get started.

At first, I inspected the documentation of my beloved carbonfox by nightfox.nvim theme to remind myself of how to extend it. I played with a few colors that I got from the SAP TechEd templates and added them to the plugin configuration of the existing theme (~/.config/nvim/lua/plugins/theme.lua), which looked something like this:

return {
    "EdenEast/nightfox.nvim",
    config = function()
        require("nightfox").setup({
            options = {
                palettes = {
                    carbonfox = {
                        bg0  = "#89D1FF", -- Dark bg (status line and float)
                        bg1  = "#EBF8FF", -- Default bg
                        sel0 = "#FF8AF0", -- Popup bg, visual selection bg                    
                        sel1 = "#FFCC00", -- Popup sel bg, search bg}
                    }
                },
                transparent = true,
                styles = {
                    comments = "italic"
                }
            }
        })
        vim.cmd "colorscheme carbonfox"
    end
}

I then realized that there had to be more to it than just changing the colors of the existing palette, as a palette contains not as many colors (16) as the theme actually uses and provides (32). I noticed that because the theme also provides config files for many terminals to copy and paste into your terminal settings (for example this kitty.conf), so that your terminal and Neovim are fully in sync - and those config files had other colors in them that where not part of the palette, plus the names of the colors in the palette did not match the ones on the config file. So now I had to understand how bg0 becomes active_tab_foreground and so on. There was probably some build step with additional logic happening here. After some digging and reverse-engineering, I came up with a mapping that allowed me to test a certain color in both my terminal and Neovim, as I now knew which color in the palette would later become which color in the terminal config:

comment
    inactive_tab_foreground

bg0
    active_tab_foreground

bg1
    background
    cursor_text_color

bg4
    inactive_border_color

fg1
    cursor none
    selection_foreground
    foreground

sel0
    selection_background
    inactive_tab_background

black
    color0

red
    color1

green
    color2
    url_color

yellow
    color3

blue
    color4
    active_border_color
    active_tab_background

magenta
    color5

cyan
    color6

white
    color7

orange
    color16
    bell_border_color 

pink
    color17

After a few iterations of tweaking colors and testing them in both Neovim and my terminal, I finally arrived at a color scheme that I liked and that resembled the SAP TechEd branding quite well. To make it easier for others to use it as well, I forked the nightfox.nvim repo and added the colors to two new themes: saptechedlightfox and saptecheddarkfox. You can find the fork on my GitHub. While digging into the repo, I found that (as already suspected) the terminal config files are generated during a build step and that there is logic in place to transform a few colors to get different shades for them. You can find these files in the extra/ directory of the repo.

The new themes can now be applied to Neovim like this (notice the module now pointing to my fork):

return {
    "nicoschoenteich/nightfox.nvim",
    config = function()
        require("nightfox").setup({
            options = {
                transparent = true,
                styles = {
                    comments = "italic"
                }
            }
        })
        vim.cmd "colorscheme saptechedlightfox"
    end
}

If you also want to apply the background image (see screenshots below), you can find in the extra/ directory of the forked repo and apply them to your terminal of choice. This is what the config looks like for kitty:

...
window_logo_path background-light.png
window_logo_position bottom-right
window_logo_alpha 1
window_logo_scale 100
...

I will close this blog post with a few screenshots of the final result:

entry.title: SAP TechEd Berlin 2025: Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action
entry.content:
A couple of words about me

My name is Stephanie Jerch, and I’m a Product Manager at SAP. 

As a Solution Expert in Product Management for SAP Cloud ALM for Operations, I empower customers to benefit from its use. Before joining SAP in 2015, I previously worked for SAP Partners in consulting roles focused on Application Lifecycle Management.  

My Session(s): 

CS101 | Discover SAP Cloud ALM for operations in action

🗓️ Wednesday, Nov 5 ⌚️ 11:15 AM - 12:00 PM CET 👉Deep Dive

What you will learn about: 

This session delves into the capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations, providing a comprehensive overview of its landscape monitoring features. Participants will learn how to effectively monitor their SAP BTP environments through through the glasses of a customer. The session will highlight the latest features and functionalities. Additionally, attendees will gain an outlook on upcoming developments and works in progress, staying informed about the future direction of SAP Cloud ALM.

Co-speakers: 

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		 Mirko Feisel
Lead BTP Plattform Engineer, Henkel AG & Co.KGaA

 

CS261 | Monitoring a custom SAP BTP application with SAP Cloud ALM for operations

🗓️ Wednesday, Nov 5. ⌚️ 3:30 PM - 5:30 PM CET 👉Hands-on Workshop

 What you will learn about: 

In this session, you will learn how to monitor a custom application on SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP), including instrumenting the services, configuring SAP Build Work Zone, embedding the SAP Cloud Logging service, and activating data collection in the SAP Cloud ALM tool. Monitor clicks with SAP Cloud ALM and SAP Cloud Logging and explore the latest features.

 Co-speakers: 

Christian Niedermayer
Cross Architect, SAP SE		Markus Bechler
Product Manager, SAP SE 		Stefan Lahr
Product Manager, SAP SE

Other related sessions I recommend:  

XP204 | Automate technical operation tasks for your applications on SAP BTP

Related community managed tags you should subscribe to remain informed about this topic: 

 SAP Cloud ALM SAP Business Technology Platform 

 Looking forward to seeing you: 

We're excited to have you join us as we explore the powerful capabilities of SAP Cloud ALM for operations. Let's dive in and discover how to optimize your landscape monitoring with live demos and insights into the latest features and AI innovations. Looking forward to an engaging and informative time together!

Now let’s hear from you: 

Turn the tides from reactive to proactive monitoring? What are your plans?

entry.title: Everything You Need to Know About SAP Discovery Center Before TechEd
entry.content:
SAP TechEd 2025 is approaching—the premier annual event for SAP developers, solution architects, and IT professionals worldwide. With thousands of sessions, hands-on workshops, and networking opportunities waiting for you, success at TechEd depends on how well-prepared you arrive. That's where the SAP Discovery Center's latest updates come in. 

From a comprehensive SAP AI Return-On-Investment (ROI) calculator that provides real-time financial justification for AI packages to an enhanced SAP BTP Guidance Framework that serves as your star map to best practices, these updates, these updates directly address the challenges you face every day: proving value, reducing implementation risk, and accelerating digital transformation timelines.

Whether you're a solution architect planning your next SAP Business Technology Platform implementation, a developer exploring AI possibilities, or an IT leader who needs to justify technology investments with hard numbers, the new SAP Discovery Center features will become your most valuable pre-TechEd preparation. Let's dive into what's new, why it matters, and how you can leverage these tools to maximize your TechEd experience and drive immediate value back to your organization.

AI on SAP Discovery Center

1. Enhanced AI Catalogue: Your Complete AI Solution Navigator

The SAP Business AI Catalogue has received a major upgrade that transforms how you explore and evaluate AI solutions. The catalogue now features dedicated categories for "Joule" and "AI Agent", making it easier than ever to find the specific AI capabilities you need for your organization.

Major Enhancements:

  • The catalogue now reflects SAP's new per-user-per-month commercial model, providing transparent pricing visibility
  • AI packages that bundle AI agents and features alongside consumption-based AI agents and features for flexible implementation options
  • Comma-separated value (CSV) export functionality allows you to download the entire AI catalogue for offline analysis, team sharing, and integration with your procurement processes

🔗Explore the enhanced AI Catalogue: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-catalog/

 

2. Streamlined Discovery with Intelligent Filtering

The completely redesigned filters improve the experience of searching through SAP Discovery Center’s AI offerings. The updated interface and enhanced look-and-feel make finding relevant offerings faster and more efficient.

Key Improvements:

  • Smart filters help you pinpoint AI offerings that match your specific use cases, industry, and technical requirements
  • At-a-glance information on catalogue cards provides essential details without requiring deep navigation
  • Improved user experience that reduces time-to-insight and accelerates your AI exploration journey

 

3. ROI-Driven Decision Making with the AI Estimator

The new Return-on-Investment (ROI) calculation feature added to the AI Estimator transforms how organizations evaluate and justify AI investments. With the ROI estimation, users can make more informed decisions on AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings.

Game-Changing Capabilities:

  • Real-time ROI calculations for both AI packages and consumption-based AI offerings
  • Transparent methodology that explains how ROI estimates are calculated, building confidence in your investment decisions
  • Business case support that provides the financial justification needed for executive approval and budget allocation

🔗Calculate your AI ROI: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/ai-estimator-v1

 

4. Integrated AI and SAP BTP Service Connections

The enhanced SAP BTP Service Catalogue with clear linkage between AI offerings and SAP BTP services now shows exactly which AI offerings relate to specific services, providing comprehensive visibility into how AI capabilities can amplify your existing SAP BTP investments.

Revolutionary Features:

  • Direct AI offering visibility within SAP BTP service detail pages eliminates the guesswork in finding relevant AI capabilities
  • Improved use case planning and implementation by understanding how AI can enhance your existing SAP BTP services, and with clear connections between the AI foundation and AI capabilities

🔗Explore integrated AI offerings: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/serviceCatalog/sap-build-process-automation?region=all&tab=relatedaiofferings

Other Updates on SAP Discovery Center

1. SAP BTP Guidance Framework: Your Star Map for Guidance Assets

The new SAP BTP Guidance Framework is a resource that extends the scope for architects by providing comprehensive methodologies and guidance. This framework serves as your guide toward architecting, developing, and deploying enterprise-grade solutions on SAP BTP.

What Makes This Framework Essential:

  • Structured adoption phases provide clear direction and a proven approach for adopting SAP BTP according to industry best practices
  • Tailored recommendations drive your organization's SAP BTP maturity through an integrated maturity assessment
  • Strategic decision support helps you make the right decisions at the right time, maximizing value from your SAP BTP investments
  • Comprehensive guidance covers everything from initial planning to advanced enterprise implementations

This framework is particularly valuable for SAP TechEd attendees who want to move beyond tactical implementations to strategic, enterprise-scale SAP BTP adoption.

🔗Access the BTP Guidance Framework: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/guidance-framework

 

2.  Events: Expanding the SAP Discovery Center Knowledge Universe

The SAP Discovery Center homepage now features a dedicated Events section. This new section serves as a centralized resource for hands-on events designed for both SAP customers and partners, adding another dimension to the Discovery Center's comprehensive learning ecosystem.

Partner and Customer Benefits:

  • Hands-on learning opportunities help customers and partners deepen their knowledge and enhance their technical skills
  • Knowledge transfer that benefits the entire ecosystem by making expertise more accessible to all audiences
  • Networking opportunities connect partners with SAP experts and fellow practitioners
  • Customer value enhancement through access to more knowledgeable, qualified partners
  • Ecosystem strengthening by making partner enablement more visible and accessible
  • Accelerated adoption through joint events that align partner capabilities with customer needs and use cases

🔗Discover events: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html#

 

3.  Latest Mission Releases: Learning That Drives Results

The SAP Discovery Center continues to expand its use case portfolio with five new missions that address the most pressing enterprise challenges:

🚀Activate Joule with SAP Integrated Business Planning (IBP)
🚀Setup of Joule in Mobile Start
🚀Accelerate Smart Supplier Selection with Retrieval-Augmented Generative AI
🚀Migrate data from SAP Business One to SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
🚀Accelerate your BTP Journey with FRE Acceleration Datasphere Pack

These hands-on experiences provide practical, implementable knowledge that bridges the gap between theoretical understanding and real-world application, ensuring both partners and customers can immediately leverage cutting-edge SAP technologies.

How Missions Guide Your Journey: 

  • Hands-on learning experiences that provide practical skills through guided, interactive tutorials and real-world scenarios
  • Self-paced exploration allows partners and customers to learn at their own speed and revisit content as needed
  • Comprehensive skill development covering beginner to advanced topics across SAP's entire technology portfolio
  • Immediate practical application with step-by-step guidance that can be implemented directly in production environments  
  • Reduced learning curve for new SAP technologies through expert-designed tutorials and best practices

🔗 Explore all new missions: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/missioncatalog

 

SAP Business Technology Platform – Priority Use Cases

Explore the comprehensive range of SAP Business Technology Platform use cases that these missions support here:

🔗https://www.sap.com/products/technology-platform/use-cases.html?sort=latest_desc

 

Your Next Steps

As you prepare for SAP TechEd 2025, think of these tools as your spacecraft's vital systems: the ROI Calculator as your fuel efficiency monitor, ensuring every investment delivers maximum propulsion; the SAP BTP Guidance Framework as your star maps, guiding you safely through complex architectural decisions; and the Events as your communication array, keeping you connected with the broader SAP ecosystem of knowledge and expertise.

The countdown to SAP TechEd has begun. Your mission parameters are set. These SAP Discovery Center updates aren't just features—they're your launch sequence for achieving breakthrough results. Whether you're embarking on your first SAP BTP expedition or you're a seasoned space traveller ready for advanced AI exploration, you now have everything needed for a successful mission.

 

Ready for liftoff to transform your SAP journey?

  • Register now and start building your agenda
  • Connect with us on social media for real-time updates
  • Join the conversation using #SAPTechEd2025

In the next blog, we will discuss our recommended sessions for your SAP TechEd agenda in more detail.

Don't just attend SAP TechEd 2025—make it the catalyst for your next breakthrough.

entry.title: SAP UI5 application to Export Data to spreadsheet from SAP UI5 tree table (sap.ui.table.TreeTable)
entry.content:
Introduction : 
    In this article, we are going to understand how to implement  export functionality the sap.ui.table.TreeTable table data to the excel(Spreadsheet) using  sap.ui.export.Spreadsheet library. In this application, we are going to create an SAP UI5 free style application which has sample JSON  data  that has employees and their family details for the expense share percentage of the medical insurance (taken as an example) and that has been binded to the UI table and a toggle button has been added to trigger the export or downloading the excel data.

Procedure: 
This is step by step guide to create a fiori application with SAP UI5 UI table and Export Button
Step 1: Create a Fiori Project

To begin, create a new SAP Fiori project using the  Fiori Generator Freestyle - Basic template. This will serve as the foundation for our application.

 

 

 

Application Folder Structure: 

 

 

Step 2 : Create a Dynamic Page , add UI Table Details and Add the sample JSON Data in controller 

  In TreeTableView.view.xml, Add this code and add the Sample JSON data model object in the onInit() in TreeTableView.Controller.js .

TreeTableView.view.xml

<mvc:View
    controllerName="com.example.treeexporttoexcel.controller.TreeTableView"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:table="sap.ui.table"
>
    <Page
        id="page"
        title="{i18n>title}"
    >
        <content>
            <table:TreeTable
                id="employeeTreeTable"
                selectionMode="None"
                enableColumnReordering="false"
                rows="{ 
       path : '/Employees',
       parameters :{
       arrayNames:['Employees','FamilyMembers']
       }
        }"
            >
               <table:extension>
                 <OverflowToolbar>
                        <Title text="{i18n>title}" />
                        <ToolbarSpacer />
                        <ToggleButton id="export_btn" text="{i18n>export_btn}" icon="sap-icon://excel-attachment" press="onExcelExport"/>
                    </OverflowToolbar>
               </table:extension>     
                <table:columns>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>employeeID}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{EmployeeID}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>employeeName}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{EmployeeName}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>designation}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Designation} " />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>familyMemberName}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{MemberName}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>relation}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Relationship}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>age}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{Age}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                    <table:Column>
                        <table:label>
                            <Text text="{i18n>expense}" />
                        </table:label>
                        <table:template>
                            <Text text="{ExpenseShare}" />
                        </table:template>
                    </table:Column>
                </table:columns>
            </table:TreeTable>
        </content>
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

TreeTable.controller.js

sap.ui.define([
    "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller",
    "sap/ui/model/json/JSONModel",
    "sap/m/MessageToast",
    "sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet"
], (Controller, JSONModel, MessageToast, Spreadsheet) => {
    "use strict";

    return Controller.extend("com.example.treeexporttoexcel.controller.TreeTableView", {
        onInit() {
            var oView = this.getOwnerComponent();
            var oDataModel = new JSONModel();
            var aData = {
                "Employees": [
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E001",
                        "EmployeeName": "Ramesh",
                        "Designation": "Manager",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Anitha",
                                "Age": 35,
                                "Relationship": "Wife",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Rohith",
                                "Age": 10,
                                "Relationship": "Son",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Ramanaiah",
                                "Age": 65,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Kamala",
                                "Age": 60,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            }
                        ]
                    },
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E002",
                        "EmployeeName": "Sumana",
                        "Designation": "Developer",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Bhargav",
                                "Age": 35,
                                "Relationship": "Husband",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Prasanna",
                                "Age": 9,
                                "Relationship": "Daughter",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Ananda",
                                "Age": 58,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Srinidhi",
                                "Age": 55,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 20
                            }
                        ]
                    },
                    {
                        "EmployeeID": "E003",
                        "EmployeeName": "Manish",
                        "Designation": "Auditor",
                        "FamilyMembers": [
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Bhumesh",
                                "Age": 58,
                                "Relationship": "Father",
                                "ExpenseShare": 60
                            },
                            {
                                "MemberName": "Rajeswari",
                                "Age": 50,
                                "Relationship": "Mother",
                                "ExpenseShare": 40
                            }
                        ]
                    }

                ]
            }

            oDataModel.setData(aData);
            oView.setModel(oDataModel);
        },
}); 
});

Step 3 : Implement the press event trigger of the Export To excel Button
   Add this logic in controller.js . "sap/ui/export/Spreadsheet" is the library should be used for excel export.
_convertTreeForExport() is a recursive function to fetch the child records converts to flat structure and pushes to the export data where this export data is passed to the settings of the excel sheet data.
TableView.controller.js

 onExcelExport() {
            var oBundle = this.getOwnerComponent().getModel("i18n").getResourceBundle();
            var oTable = this.byId("employeeTreeTable");
            var oBinding = oTable.getBinding("rows");
            var aData = oBinding.getModel().getProperty("/Employees");
            var aExportData = this._convertTreeForExport(aData);
            var aCols = [
                {
                    label : oBundle.getText("employeeID"),
                    property :"EmployeeID"
                },
                {
                     label : oBundle.getText("employeeName"),
                    property :"EmployeeName"

                },
                {
                      label : oBundle.getText("designation"),
                    property :"Designation"
                },
                {
                       label :oBundle.getText("familyMemberName"),
                    property :"MemberName"

                },
                {

                       label : oBundle.getText("relation"),
                    property :"Relationship"
                },
                  {

                       label : oBundle.getText("age"),
                    property :"Age"
                }, {

                       label :  oBundle.getText("expense"),
                    property :"ExpenseShare"
                }
            ]
            var oSettings = {
                workbook: {
                    columns: aCols,
                    context: {
                        sheetName: oBundle.getText("sheetName")
                    }
                },
                dataSource: aExportData,
                fileName: oBundle.getText("fileName"),
                worker: false
            };
            var oSpreadsheet = new Spreadsheet(oSettings);
            oSpreadsheet.build().then(function () {
                MessageToast.show(oBundle.getText("successMessage"));
            }).finally(function () {
                oSpreadsheet.destroy();
            })
        },
          
        _convertTreeForExport(aNodes, iLevel =0, aResult =[]){
// aNodes will have the tree table  data 
// iLevel -> current hierarchy depth initializes with 0
// aResult -> collector array of the flattened data 
            aNodes.forEach(oNode => {
                // taking shallow copy of each node to perform manipulations on the copy node without  // disturbing the actual data node
                   var oCopy = { ...oNode };
// deleting FamilyMembers nested structure to avoid recursion loops if not deleted it will throw  // the maximum call stack exceeded error
                delete oCopy.FamilyMembers;
                oCopy.level = iLevel + 1;
// creates a new field for visualize indentation  parent, child, grandchild etc., 
                oCopy.IndentedName = `${"".repeat(iLevel*4)}${oNode.name}`
                aResult.push(oCopy);
                if(oNode.FamilyMembers && oNode.FamilyMembers.length > 0){
                    this._convertTreeForExport(oNode.FamilyMembers, iLevel + 1, aResult);
                }
            });
               return aResult
        }

Application Screen:

 

 

ExportData.xlsx

 

 

Git Link for reference
https://github.com/RangarajasreeSV/tree-table-export-to-excel-ui5

Conclusion: 
By following these steps, We can achieve the export functionality of the The SAP UI tree table data to the Excel spreadsheet.


Thanks and Regards,
Sree Vedavyasa Rangarajasree

entry.title: Customers and Partners Innovate Without Limits on SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build
entry.content:
Across industries and around the world, organizations are discovering new possibilities with SAP Business Technology Platform (SAP BTP). By connecting their business ecosystem, building apps, and automating processes with intelligence, they’re driving faster innovation and growth.

With SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, companies can easily connect systems, create applications quickly, and automate processes with AI, unlocking value and agility like never before.

Here are some of the ways customers and partners are driving transformation with SAP BTP.

Olam Agri: Unlocking Cash Flow and Real-Time Insights

  • Global agri-business Olam Agri (S$33.2 billion in annual revenue) transformed its finance operations with SAP BTP.
  • In just nine months, Olam Agri migrated from ECC to RISE with SAP on AWS, covering 35 countries and 90 entities.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, the company established real-time bank connectivity and freed S$250 million in treasury cash.
  • With SAP Build, Olam Agri created cost-tracking apps that deliver near-real-time visibility across its global operations.

📽️ Watch the Olam Agri Story to see how connected finance drives results.

Mindsprint: Scaling Digital Transformation Worldwide

  • Operating in more than 60 countries, Mindsprint helps customers accelerate their RISE with SAP and GROW with SAP journeys.
  • Using SAP Integration Suite, Mindsprint connects SAP and non-SAP systems while maintaining a clean ERP core. With SAP Build, Mindsprint develops scalable custom extensions and AI-driven process intelligence to help customers optimize their business performance.

📽️ Watch the Mindsprint Partner Story to learn how innovation scales globally.

Visa: Embedding Payments Seamlessly into ERP

  • Visa Commercial Solutions, in collaboration with ABeam Consulting, is simplifying B2B payments through embedded finance.
  • With SAP Integration Suite, Visa connected its global payment network directly to SAP systems, enabling automated reconciliation and direct invoice payments.
  • Using SAP Build, the team delivered a smooth in-app payment experience from concept to go-live in just six months.

📽️ Watch the Visa Story to see how embedded finance accelerates business.

ABeam Consulting: Driving Intelligent Enterprise Innovation

  • With more than 9,000 consultants across Asia, ABeam Consulting delivers end-to-end SAP transformations across SAP ERP Cloud, SuccessFactors, Ariba, and Concur.
  • Leveraging SAP BTP with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build, ABeam helps customers integrate complex system landscapes while extending business processes with rapid application development that leverages AI and Joule-powered automation.

📽️ Watch the ABeam Partner Story to see how automation and AI are redefining enterprise innovation.

Mamee: Building Agility and Modernizing Operations

  • Snacking leader Mamee partnered with cbs Consulting to strengthen its operations and build a more agile business foundation.
  • Implemented RISE with SAP, SAP Integration Suite, and SAP Build.
  • Reduced integration errors by 70%.
  • Achieved 100% improvement in cash-flow monitoring and 50% faster approvals.
  • With a modern, connected digital core, Mamee is fueling growth with greater efficiency and transparency.

📽️ Watch the Mamee Story to see how digital agility drives performance.

cbs Consulting: Partnering for Continuous Innovation

  • With more than 30 years of SAP partnership, cbs Consulting helps organizations move confidently to the cloud and innovate on SAP BTP.
  • cbs Consulting develops smart extensions, automates processes, and connects SAP and non-SAP systems with SAP Build and SAP Integration Suite. Its accelerators help customers reduce technical debt and streamline migrations to SAP S/4HANA.
  • Through close collaboration with SAP, cbs is embedding AI and machine learning into customer solutions.

📽️ Watch the cbs Partner Story to learn about their innovative approach.

Now It's Your Turn to Innovate Without Limits

I hope these stories inspire you to start your innovation journey with SAP BTP. Explore how SAP partners can help you with their deep experience, skills, and domain expertise with SAP Integration Suite and SAP Build solutions. 

Register now for complimentary partner discovery webinars or workshops to see how they can help you. 

  • SAP Integration Suite Partner Webinars  
  • SAP Build Partner Discovery Workshops

If you’re an SAP partner, access a wealth of exclusive resources on SAP PartnerEdge to further accelerate your growth and success with SAP BTP.

entry.title: Frontend Strategies for SAP Sales Cloud V2: An Architect’s Perspective on Modern UI Extensions
entry.content:
Introduction

As an SAP architect, I’m sharing my perspective on choosing the right frontend technologies and design strategies for SAP Sales Cloud V2. Selecting the appropriate frontend is not just about framework preference—it impacts user experience, integration, maintainability, performance, scalability, and adherence to SAP’s design principles.

While SAP Fiori provides a standardized and proven design framework, Sales Cloud V2 introduces a modern, non-Fiori-based UI. In this article, I’ll provide guidance on balancing Fiori compliance, lightweight frontend frameworks like React, seamless backend integration, performance, and scalability, along with best practices for extensions, mashups, and side-by-side scenarios with S/4HANA.

Understanding SAP Sales Cloud V2's UI

SAP Sales Cloud V2 introduces a modern, intuitive UI designed to enhance user experience and productivity. Unlike traditional SAP Fiori applications, V2's UI is not strictly Fiori-based. It leverages contemporary design principles to provide a seamless and engaging user interface.

For a visual overview of SAP Sales Cloud V2 UI.

 

Frontend Development Considerations

1. Aligning with SAP Fiori Design Principles

SAP Fiori offers a set of design principles aimed at creating consistent and user-friendly interfaces. While V2's UI is not Fiori-based, developers can still adhere to Fiori's design guidelines to ensure a cohesive user experience. Key considerations include:

  • Consistency: Maintaining uniform design elements across applications.
  • Efficiency: Optimizing workflows to reduce user effort.
  • Intuitiveness: Designing interfaces that are easy to understand and navigate.
  • Performance: Ensuring fast rendering and responsiveness.
  • Scalability: Designing the frontend to handle growing user loads and data volumes efficiently.

2. Choosing the Right Frontend Technology

The choice of frontend technology should align with the application's requirements and the desired user experience. Consider:

  • Fiori Elements (CAP / UI5): Ideal for OData-based applications requiring standardized Fiori UI patterns. Leveraging SAP BTP CAP best practices, Fiori Elements provide:
    • Metadata-driven UI generation (List Report, Object Page, Analytical List Page)
    • Out-of-the-box CRUD operations
    • Automatic audit log and change history of business object tracking.In CAP, with simple annotations and minimal effort, audit logging tracks user and system actions for compliance, while change history tracking records the actual data changes in business objects — capturing before and after field values for complete business transparency.
    • Attachment management support
    • Event-driven integration through SAP Event Mesh
    • Extensibility for custom fields and actions
    • Built-in navigation, filtering, and sorting features
    • Validations and field-level rules defined in CDS models are automatically enforced, ensuring consistent data integrity across UI and backend.
    • Support for multitenancy, authentication, and authorization using SAP BTP XSUAA.
    • Integration with OData v4, REST, and messaging-based endpoints.
    • Note: If Fiori Elements annotations do not fully meet business requirements, teams should agree with business stakeholders to address those scenarios using custom UI extensions. This is not a limitation of CAP or Fiori Elements but reflects a custom requirement beyond the framework’s standardized scope.
  • UI5 Web Components for React: Use Fiori-compliant components within a React app to combine flexibility with consistency.
    Documentation
  • React with Custom Components: For applications requiring highly customized UI aligned with Sales Cloud V2 look & feel.
  • UI5 Freestyle (SAPUI5): For deep integration with SAP backend and traditional Fiori look & feel.

When to Choose Fiori Elements for Sales Cloud V2

  • Backend services are OData-based
  • Standard UI patterns like List Report, Object Page, or Analytical List Page meet requirements
  • Minimal custom UI is needed
  • Out-of-the-box features (CRUD, attachments, audit/change history) are beneficial
  • Strict adherence to Fiori design guidelines is required
  • Faster delivery and lower TCO is a priority
  • Extensibility for custom fields and actions is needed

Balancing Look & Feel vs Out-of-the-Box Fiori

When integrating with backend services, consider:

  • Use Fiori Elements: When OData backend, standard UI patterns suffice, and business prioritizes rapid delivery, TCO, and built-in CAP features.
  • Use Custom / Lightweight Frontend: When business requires UI to match Sales Cloud V2 look & feel, heavy customization, or mashups.
  • Hybrid Approach: Combine CAP Fiori Elements for standard functionality with custom/lightweight frontends for specialized UI requirements.

Backend Integration Considerations

  • OData Services: Standard SAP protocol for frontend-backend communication
  • GraphQL: Flexible alternative to OData
  • REST APIs: For external service integration

Choose the backend service type that aligns with your frontend framework to ensure seamless integration, optimal performance, and scalability.

Extensions, Mashups, and SAP Build Apps

SAP Sales Cloud V2 supports extensions and mashups to enhance functionality:

  • Sales Cloud Extensions: Built on SAP BTP to extend V2 capabilities
  • Mashups: Embed external apps or services into Sales Cloud interface

Mashup-Based HTML UI

  • Work List: Mashup as work center feature
  • Detail View: Display detailed info in context
  • Quick View: Summarized data for fast access

Extensibility Using SAP Build Apps

SAP Build Apps enables no-code/low-code apps for all form factors. Extensions can be embedded in Sales Cloud V2.

  • Included for tenants with 100+ users
  • Additional licensing required for fewer than 100 users

References for Mashups and SAP Build Apps

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Solution Guide (PDF)
  • SAP Build Apps Setup Guide for Sales Cloud V2
  • Design and Develop Extensions using SAP AppGyver

Recommendations

  • Use Fiori Elements (CAP/UI5) for OData-based apps with standard UI patterns and built-in features (CRUD, attachments, audit)
  • Use React / custom frontend to match Sales Cloud V2 look & feel when business requires visual consistency or heavy customization
  • Use UI5 Freestyle for deep SAP backend integration and traditional Fiori UX
  • Consider hybrid approaches combining Fiori Elements and custom/lightweight frontends
  • Extensions and mashups should prioritize performance, consistency, security
  • Side-by-side scenarios with S/4HANA: maintain SAP UI5 for OData backend integration
  • Backend service type (OData, REST, GraphQL) influences frontend choice and integration approach

References

  • SAP Sales Cloud Version 2 Overview
  • UI5 Web Components for React Documentation
  • Comparison Between SAPUI5 and Web Components
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 Features and Roadmap
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 with S/4HANA in Action
  • SAP Sales Cloud V2 Solution Guide (PDF)
  • SAP Build Apps Setup Guide for Sales Cloud V2
  • Design and Develop Extensions using SAP AppGyver

Key Takeaways

  • Choosing the frontend technology for SAP Sales Cloud V2 requires balancing look & feel, performance, scalability, and integration capabilities.
  • For Fiori-compliant UI, Fiori Elements (CAP/UI5) or UI5 Freestyle are preferred for OData-based apps.
  • For customized, lightweight UI aligned with Sales Cloud V2, use React or other modern frameworks.
  • CAP Fiori Elements provide out-of-the-box advantages: CRUD, attachments, audit/change history, navigation, filtering, and extensibility.
  • Hybrid approaches can combine standard Fiori Elements with custom frontends for specialized UX needs.
  • Backend service type (OData, REST, GraphQL) influences frontend technology choice.
  • Extensions and mashups should prioritize consistency, performance, and security.
  • Side-by-side scenarios (Sales Cloud V2 & S/4HANA) benefit from using SAP UI5 technologies for OData backend integration.

entry.title: Activate Joule Studio in 5 Simple Steps
entry.content:
Joule Studio is a capability in SAP Build that allows organizations to create and deploy custom Joule agents and skills that automate workflows and improve efficiency across SAP and non-SAP systems. Currently the Agent Builder offering is in Beta and the Skill Builder  offering is generally available. In this blog, we will focus on activation of the Skill Builder in Joule which is now Generally Available.

The key pre-requisites to activate Skill Builder with Joule Studio are as follows:-
Access to BTP Global Account with the following entitlements available via Subscription, BTPEA, CPEA or PAYG model

  • SAP Build Process Automation, build-default (Application) plan
  • Joule, foundation (Application)/ standard (Application) plan
  • Active instance of SAP Cloud Identity Services for Identity Authentication and Identity Provisioning  

Read more about the service and pre-requisites in these following blogs from our product leaders and managers:

  • Joule Studio is generally available in SAP Build: Empower your business with intelligent automation
  • Build, Deploy, and Extend AI Agents with Joule Studio
  • How to Get Started with Joule Studio

Activating Joule Studio - Skill Builder in 5 Simple Steps

Here is a quick hit video capturing the steps documented below:

 

Stay updated on the latest Business AI services and activation guides by following the SAP Business AI Onboarding Resource Center

Onto the Joule. Studio- Skill Builder Activation!

Step 1 - Create a BTP Subaccount and Assign the Entitlements:

Create a subaccount in your BTP Global Account and select region where both Joule, foundation/ standard and Build Process Automation, build-default plans are available. Find the list of regions supported for Joule service at this SAP Help Portal link and Build Process Automation Service at this SAP Help Portal link.

  • Click on Create button on BTP Global Account landing page and select Subaccount option

  • Enter the relevant details including selecting the suitable region and click on Create button

Enable Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Click on Enable Cloud Foundry button on the subaccount landing page

  • Update the details in the window and click on Create button

Create Space in the Cloud Foundry Environment

  • Select the Create Space button that appears after the Cloud Foundry Environment is created

  • Select the relevant roles and click on the Create button

Add Joule and  Build Process Automation entitlements

  • Navigate to Entitlements section from subaccount landing page
  • Click on Edit button

  • Select Add Service Plans button

 

  • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the foundation (Application) plan of the Joule service 

  • Next, search for build process in the search bar and select the build-default (Application) plan from SAP Build Process Automation service
  • Click on  Add 2 Service Plans button to add the entitlements to the relevant subaccount

  • Click on Save button on the Entitlements page

Step 2- Complete Trust Configuration and Activate Build Process Automation (Subaccount):

Create a Trust Configuration to add authentication for application users in the IAS tenant on BTP

  • Navigate to Security > Trust Configuration section under your BTP subaccount
  • Click on Establish Trust button

  • Select the suitable IAS tenant and click on Next button

  • Choose the domain consistent with your BTP account and non-BTP applications and click on the Next button

  • Review and update the relevant parameters in this screen and click on Next button

  • Review the details and click on Finish button

Enable the Build Process Automation Service, build-default plan

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions section under your BTP subaccount and click on Create button

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation service and build-default plan and click on Create button

  • The service will be created as seen under Subscriptions

Step 3 - Run Joule Booster to Activate Joule Studio Capability Package (Global Account):

Activate Joule Studio Capability Package on SAP Build Process Automation

  • Navigate to your BTP Global Account and select the Boosters section
    • Search for Joule in the search bar and select the Setting Up Joule booster tile

  • Click on Start button

  • After the prerequisites are checked and required entitlements are met, click on Next button 

  • Select the Joule (das-application) plan and the subaccount where Build Process Automation service is activated and click on Next button

  • After selecting the products to be integrated on the following screen and selecting relevant system type option click on Next button. Review Integrating Joule with SAP Solutions help document for more details on pre-requisites for integration with the relevant SAP systems in your organization

  • Select the SAP Build Process Automation option from the Capability Packages dropdown, click on Next button

  • Review the Formation Name and select the correct service instance number - URL from the SAP Build Process Automation System dropdown then click on the Next button

  • Review the details on the final page of the booster and click on Finish button

  • After processing, the Success window appears, click on the Close button after reviewing status

Step 4 - Create Role Collection and Assign Users (Subaccount):

Create Role Collection and assign the role collection the relevant users

  • Navigate to the Subaccount where the Build Process Automation service is installed and navigate to the Role Collections section and click on Create button; Enter the relevant details and click on Create button

  • Select the recently created role collection line item from the list and click on Edit button

  • Select search help option in first empty line item under Roles

  • Enter the search text "das" Application Identifier dropdown, select the right option from the list and select the end_user and extensibility_developer roles from the list below. Click on Add button after selecting the roles

  • Click the Save button for the role collection we created

  • Navigate to Users option under the Security section of the subaccount and click Create button

  • Select the Identity Provider for which the trust configuration was added, add the user details and click on Create button

  • Click on the new user created in the table, navigate to Role Collections section, click on the options(...) and select Assign Role Collections option

  • Select the role collection created in the previous step from the list along with any other relevant roles and click on the Assign Role Collection button

  • Navigate to Instances and Subscriptions and select the SAP Build Process Automation instance

  • Click on Create after the Build Lobby loads

  • The Joule Skill option should now be available for you to create custom Joule Skills

Step 5 - Build Your First Custom Joule Skill:

Follow the Build custom Joule skills for SAP and non-SAP systems using Joule Studio mission to get started with building your custom skills on Joule Studio.

Congratulations, you are all set to start building Custom Skills with the Skill Builder on Joule Studio!

Please do leave kudos and comments as feedback to help us keep improving the quality of our content.

Additional Resources 

Architecture Overview

Joule Skill Demo Video

Smart Advisory Companion – Inspiration Video

🧭 Product Tour

FAQ

entry.title: SAP集成套件概况介绍
entry.content:
SAP集成套件是什么，它从何而来？

SAP集成套件（SAP Integration Suite）是SAP推出的云原生集成平台，诞生于2020年，作为SAP BTP集成能力域的核心组件，专门解决企业应用集成的挑战。它整合了SAP在集成领域的多项技术积累，为混合云时代的企业架构提供统一的集成解决方案。

 

SAP开发集成套件的目的是什么？

1. 应对日益复杂的集成挑战： 现代企业的IT架构越来越复杂，云应用、本地系统、SaaS服务、API接口数量激增。传统的点对点集成方式已经无法应对这种复杂性，维护成本高昂且容易出错。SAP集成套件提供了一个统一的集成平台，将复杂的集成关系简化为星型架构，大幅降低了集成的复杂度和维护成本，同时还帮助用户利用上B2B集成，事件驱动集成等新型集成技术。

 

2. 释放数据价值，打破信息孤岛： 许多企业虽然部署了SAP ERP等核心系统，但数据往往被困在各个独立的应用中，无法形成统一的数据视图。集成套件通过标准化的数据传输和转换能力，帮助企业打通数据流转，让ERP中的核心业务数据能够实时流向BI系统、电商平台、移动应用等，真正实现数据驱动的业务决策。

 

SAP集成套件由什么组成，可以用来干什么？

集成套件的功能主要包括云集成、API管理、B2B集成，事件驱动集成这四块。

集成套件基于云原生架构设计，可以自动根据需求调节资源，保证性能稳定；同时还配备了打通内网的云连接器(SAP Cloud Connector)以实现云与内网的安全对接，以及实现内网到内网集成的边缘集成组件(Edge Integration Cell)，以实现异构网络环境的安全打通

并且，与通用集成平台不同的是，集成套件更懂SAP生态：

  • 预置了数百个SAP应用的连接器和集成模板
  • 内置RFC、IDoc、BAPI等SAP专有协议的支持
  • 提供开箱即用的预定义集成内容

同时兼顾现代技术栈和传统SAP架构：

  • 支持REST、GraphQL等现代API标准
  • 保持对SAP GUI、WebService等传统接口的完美兼容
  • 通过云连接器安全打通本地SAP系统与云端应用

 

SAP集成套件该怎么用呢？

对于不同规模的企业，集成套件的应用场景各有侧重：

中小型企业：可以采用集成套件作为企业服务总线，统一管理所有系统间的数据交换，建立标准化的集成治理体系。

大型企业：面临多云、混合云的复杂架构：

  • 可以进一步利用API管理功能，通过统一的API网关管理数百个服务接口
  • 可以进一步利用B2B功能，和上下游企业对接，无需邮件/电话即可实时获取供给/需求的状态
  • 可以利用事件驱动能力，将S/4HANA为代表的SAP应用作为事件源，无需代码开发，仅配置就可以实现真正的完全实时集成, 任何新的变化都可以让其他系统最快获知，进而赋予业务部门竞争优势（而不是通过定时任务或短时间轮询达成的假实时）
